episodes.title: A Cult Survivor's Recap | The Full Story in 20 Minutes | "My Youth Pastors Became Cult Leaders"
episodes.description:
If you're new here, you may just be learning that I am an ex-cult member and current mental health Counselor. This is the summary of my story, one in which I joined a youth group, and was groomed by my youth pastors to join their "dream ministry," in which they made money under the guise of the "troubled teen industry." These youth pastors feigned good intentions, but were slowly entrapping us, taking us further and further from our families, and independence. Once they gained our trust, they started a "ministry" called, "Adullam Youth Outreach." This is the entity under which more than 50 teens and young adults (and counting) would go on to suffer abuse over the course of 14 years. 

For the last six months, I, along with others, have shared stories of abuse, and exposed the truth of OUR side of the story, which was suppressed for so long. I have a 12 part series on those stories under my playlist, "How NOT to Join A Cult," where you can learn many more details of those allegations, where they are now, etc., which I briefly touch on here. 

I forgot to add this in, but here is what I've learned through this process;
**Some people deal with difficult things by not thinking about them. It isn't my place to judge how anyone's path unfolds. But, I am ok with the fact that not everyone will understand mine. Even if I struggle with that sometimes.
**Two conflicting experiences often can exist at the same time. But abuse IS abuse, and an abuser can still seem "nice," or have excuses made for them. That is often why abuse is not straightforward, easy, or something anyone wants to have to address.
**I feel an endless amount of closure, and surrealness. I always felt their exposure would make me re-evaluate spirituality and coincidence, and leave me with a lot to ponder, and it has. I just didn't know I would be the one exposing after all these years. 
**I even have less symptoms of CPTSD than I used to.
**The support has greatly outweighed those who deny, or undermine, our allegations.
**I do believe that there needs to be major reform in Christianity, especially surrounding mental health, accountability, protection of children, and healthy versus unhealthy group dynamics. Otherwise, these types of abuse will continue to happen.

If you're returning for my re-cap, what questions do you still have? What perplexed you the most? What key factors do you feel need to be changed in order to prevent this in the future? WHAT in the WORLD should I talk about next???

episodes.title: Brook's Story | Surviving Mark & Leslie Dollar | "Made me wash my stalker's car for money."
episodes.description:
Brook was left with no other option than to rely on others after finding herself facing homelessness, before she had even graduated from high school, in 2013.

She met Mark and Leslie Dollar through a church, and ended up utilizing their seemingly kind offer to come and live on their property. Having no other option, she had to accept. Unfortunately, she did not find any more safety or refuge while living with them than she found in any other situation she had been in.

Some may argue that Mark and Leslie helped these young people. I am not above stating that they did indeed offer shelter and precisely THREE basic meals a day (no snacks provided). However, this can be true, and the fact that they abused and exploited these young people, is also true at the same time. Abuse occurred. Full advantage was taken of these young people. 

Brook experienced this abuse, as well as various inappropriate moments, while living with Mark and Leslie Dollar from age 18-22. Not only did Mark have a disturbingly close attachment to her, even making fun of his own wife to her, but she also experienced scary behavior from other boys that seemed to be encouraged by Mark. Mark continued to text her years after she left.

In addition, everything she did was controlled. Leslie threatened to take away Brook’s vehicle, and also called her a slut and a whore, for not wanting to change jobs at their orders. Most adults were forced to work at the same location, just as the children were all forced to go to the same school, or later on, the same “post education,” The Ramp. Leslie constantly belittled Brook, as she has done others, usually calling her a slut and a whore.

As a reminder, Mark and Leslie Dollar abused dozens, if not a hundred, teens, before moving on to where they now work and associate, The Ramp, in Hamilton, Alabama, under Karen Wheaton. They are still using young people and teens for financial gain to this day.
